snippet: In conversations last week with Republican senators and rank-and-file members of Congress, President Obama hopes to build a broad consensus on deficit reduction that includes new revenue.
abstract: Pres Obama has begun reaching out to senators in a bid to isolate Republican leaders in Congress and force a compromise on a budget deal that can reverse the across-the-board spending cuts that have gone into effect; he says he hopes to build a broad consensus on deficit reduction that includes new revenue sources.
lead_paragraph: In conversations last week with Republican senators and rank-and-file members of Congress, President Obama hopes to build a broad consensus on deficit reduction that includes new revenue.

headline.seo: Obama Seeks Compromise on Budget Cuts With G.O.P. Senators
headline.main: Seeking Compromise, President Reaches Out to the Rank and File
headline.print_headline: Seeking Compromise, President Reaches Out To the Rank and File
